 10 21 a physician or other provider.
 10 22    (2)  Termination of a lease or other property contract or
 10 23 other nonmonetary remedies  provided by a lease or contract,
 10 24 not including loss or restriction of medical staff privileges
 10 25 or  exclusion from a provider panel, if the sanctioned
 10 26 provider acts under this chapter while on the premises of the
 10 27 sanctioning health care provider or on property that is owned
 10 28 by or under the direct control of the sanctioning health care
 10 29 provider.
 10 30    (3)  Termination of a contract or other nonmonetary remedies
 10 31 provided by a contract if the sanctioned provider acts under
 10 32 this chapter while acting in the course and scope of the
 10 33 sanctioned provider's capacity as an employee or independent
 10 34 contractor of the sanctioning health care provider. Nothing
 10 35 in this subparagraph shall be construed to prevent any of the
 11  1 following:
 11  2    (a)  A health care provider from acting under this chapter
 11  3 while acting  outside the course and scope of the provider's
 11  4 capacity as an employee or independent contractor.
 11  5    (b)  A patient from contracting with the patient's attending
 11  6 physician and consulting physician to act outside the course
 11  7 and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11  8 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11  9    c.  A health care provider that imposes sanctions pursuant to
 11 10 paragraph "b" shall follow all due process and other procedures
 11 11 the sanctioning health care provider uses for the imposition of
 11 12 sanctions on other health care providers under the authority of
 11 13 the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 14    d.  For the purposes of this subsection:
 11 15    (1)  "Action under this chapter" means to perform the
 11 16 duties of an  attending physician, the consulting physician
 11 17 function, or the counseling function as specified under this
 11 18 chapter. "Action under this chapter" does not include any of
 11 19 the following:
 11 20    (a)  Making an initial determination that a patient has
 11 21 a terminal disease and informing the patient of the medical
 11 22 prognosis.
 11 23    (b)  Providing information about this chapter to a patient
 11 24 upon the  request of the patient.
 11 25    (c)  Providing a patient, upon the request of the patient,
 11 26 with a referral to another physician.
 11 27    (d)  A patient contracting with the patient's attending
 11 28 physician and consulting physician to act outside of the
 11 29 course and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11 30 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 31    (2)  "Notify" means a separate statement in writing to the
 11 32 health care provider  specifically informing the health care
 11 33 provider prior to the provider's action under this chapter of
 11 34 the sanctioning health care provider's policy about actions
 11 35 under this chapter.
 12  1    Sec. 15.    9 14    2.  A professional organization or association, or
  9 15 health care provider, shall not subject a person to censure,
  9 16 discipline, suspension, loss of license, loss of privileges,
  9 17 loss of  membership, or other penalty for acting or refusing to
  9 18 act in good=faith compliance with this chapter.
  9 19    3.  A request by a patient for or provision by an attending
  9 20 physician of medication in good=faith compliance with this
  9 21 chapter shall not constitute neglect under the law or provide
  9 22 the sole basis for the appointment of a guardian or conservator
  9 23 for the patient.
  9 24    4.  A health care provider shall not be under any duty,
  9 25 whether by contract, statute, or any other legal requirement,
  9 26 to participate in the provision to a qualified patient of
  9 27 medication to end the patient's life pursuant to this chapter.
  9 28 If a health care provider is unable or unwilling to carry out a
  9 29 patient's request under this chapter  and the patient transfers
  9 30 the patient's care to a new health care provider, the prior
  9 31 health care provider shall transfer, upon request, a copy of
  9 32 the patient's relevant medical records to the new health care
  9 33 provider.
  9 34    5.  a.  Notwithstanding any other provision of law to the
  9 35 contrary, a health care provider may prohibit another health
 10  1 care provider from acting under this chapter on the premises
 10  2 of the prohibiting provider if the prohibiting provider has
 10  3 notified the health care provider of the prohibiting provider's
 10  4 policy regarding actions under this chapter. Nothing in this
 10  5 paragraph shall prevent a health care provider from providing
 10  6 health care services to a patient that do not constitute action
 10  7 under this chapter.
 10  8    b.  Notwithstanding the provisions of this section to the
 10  9 contrary,  a health  care provider may subject another health
 10 10 care provider to the following sanctions if the sanctioning
 10 11 health care provider has notified the sanctioned provider prior
 10 12 to action under this chapter that the health care provider
 10 13 prohibits actions under this chapter:
 10 14    (1)  Loss of privileges, loss of membership, or other
 10 15 sanction provided pursuant to the medical staff bylaws,
 10 16 policies, or procedures of the sanctioning health care provider
 10 17 if the sanctioned provider is a member of the sanctioning
 10 18 provider's medical staff and acts under this chapter while on
 10 19 the health care facility premises of the sanctioning health
 10 20 care provider, but not including the private medical office of
 10 21 a physician or other provider.
 10 22    (2)  Termination of a lease or other property contract or
 10 23 other nonmonetary remedies  provided by a lease or contract,
 10 24 not including loss or restriction of medical staff privileges
 10 25 or  exclusion from a provider panel, if the sanctioned
 10 26 provider acts under this chapter while on the premises of the
 10 27 sanctioning health care provider or on property that is owned
 10 28 by or under the direct control of the sanctioning health care
 10 29 provider.
 10 30    (3)  Termination of a contract or other nonmonetary remedies
 10 31 provided by a contract if the sanctioned provider acts under
 10 32 this chapter while acting in the course and scope of the
 10 33 sanctioned provider's capacity as an employee or independent
 10 34 contractor of the sanctioning health care provider. Nothing
 10 35 in this subparagraph shall be construed to prevent any of the
 11  1 following:
 11  2    (a)  A health care provider from acting under this chapter
 11  3 while acting  outside the course and scope of the provider's
 11  4 capacity as an employee or independent contractor.
 11  5    (b)  A patient from contracting with the patient's attending
 11  6 physician and consulting physician to act outside the course
 11  7 and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11  8 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11  9    c.  A health care provider that imposes sanctions pursuant to
 11 10 paragraph "b" shall follow all due process and other procedures
 11 11 the sanctioning health care provider uses for the imposition of
 11 12 sanctions on other health care providers under the authority of
 11 13 the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 14    d.  For the purposes of this subsection:
 11 15    (1)  "Action under this chapter" means to perform the
 11 16 duties of an  attending physician, the consulting physician
 11 17 function, or the counseling function as specified under this
 11 18 chapter. "Action under this chapter" does not include any of
 11 19 the following:
 11 20    (a)  Making an initial determination that a patient has
 11 21 a terminal disease and informing the patient of the medical
 11 22 prognosis.

 11 33 provider prior to the provider's action under this chapter of
 11 34 the sanctioning health care provider's policy about actions
 11 35 under this chapter.

 10 28 by or under the direct control of the sanctioning health care
 10 29 provider.
 10 30    (3)  Termination of a contract or other nonmonetary remedies
 10 31 provided by a contract if the sanctioned provider acts under
 10 32 this chapter while acting in the course and scope of the
 10 33 sanctioned provider's capacity as an employee or independent
 10 34 contractor of the sanctioning health care provider. Nothing
 10 35 in this subparagraph shall be construed to prevent any of the
 11  1 following:
 11  2    (a)  A health care provider from acting under this chapter
 11  3 while acting  outside the course and scope of the provider's
 11  4 capacity as an employee or independent contractor.
 11  5    (b)  A patient from contracting with the patient's attending
 11  6 physician and consulting physician to act outside the course
 11  7 and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11  8 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11  9    c.  A health care provider that imposes sanctions pursuant to
 11 10 paragraph "b" shall follow all due process and other procedures
 11 11 the sanctioning health care provider uses for the imposition of
 11 12 sanctions on other health care providers under the authority of
 11 13 the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 14    d.  For the purposes of this subsection:
 11 15    (1)  "Action under this chapter" means to perform the
 11 16 duties of an  attending physician, the consulting physician
 11 17 function, or the counseling function as specified under this
 11 18 chapter. "Action under this chapter" does not include any of
 11 19 the following:
 11 20    (a)  Making an initial determination that a patient has
 11 21 a terminal disease and informing the patient of the medical
 11 22 prognosis.
 11 23    (b)  Providing information about this chapter to a patient
 11 24 upon the  request of the patient.
 11 25    (c)  Providing a patient, upon the request of the patient,
 11 26 with a referral to another physician.
 11 27    (d)  A patient contracting with the patient's attending
 11 28 physician and consulting physician to act outside of the
 11 29 course and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11 30 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 31    (2)  "Notify" means a separate statement in writing to the
 11 32 health care provider  specifically informing the health care
 11 33 provider prior to the provider's action under this chapter of
 11 34 the sanctioning health care provider's policy about actions
 11 35 under this chapter.
 12  1    Sec. 15.    9 20 physician of medication in good=faith compliance with this
  9 21 chapter shall not constitute neglect under the law or provide
  9 22 the sole basis for the appointment of a guardian or conservator
  9 23 for the patient.
  9 24    4.  A health care provider shall not be under any duty,
  9 25 whether by contract, statute, or any other legal requirement,
  9 26 to participate in the provision to a qualified patient of
  9 27 medication to end the patient's life pursuant to this chapter.
  9 28 If a health care provider is unable or unwilling to carry out a
  9 29 patient's request under this chapter  and the patient transfers
  9 30 the patient's care to a new health care provider, the prior
  9 31 health care provider shall transfer, upon request, a copy of
  9 32 the patient's relevant medical records to the new health care
  9 33 provider.
  9 34    5.  a.  Notwithstanding any other provision of law to the
  9 35 contrary, a health care provider may prohibit another health
 10  1 care provider from acting under this chapter on the premises
 10  2 of the prohibiting provider if the prohibiting provider has
 10  3 notified the health care provider of the prohibiting provider's
 10  4 policy regarding actions under this chapter. Nothing in this
 10  5 paragraph shall prevent a health care provider from providing
 10  6 health care services to a patient that do not constitute action
 10  7 under this chapter.
 10  8    b.  Notwithstanding the provisions of this section to the
 10  9 contrary,  a health  care provider may subject another health
 10 10 care provider to the following sanctions if the sanctioning
 10 11 health care provider has notified the sanctioned provider prior
 10 12 to action under this chapter that the health care provider
 10 13 prohibits actions under this chapter:
 10 14    (1)  Loss of privileges, loss of membership, or other
 10 15 sanction provided pursuant to the medical staff bylaws,
 10 16 policies, or procedures of the sanctioning health care provider
 10 17 if the sanctioned provider is a member of the sanctioning
 10 18 provider's medical staff and acts under this chapter while on
 10 19 the health care facility premises of the sanctioning health
 10 20 care provider, but not including the private medical office of
 10 21 a physician or other provider.
 10 22    (2)  Termination of a lease or other property contract or
 10 23 other nonmonetary remedies  provided by a lease or contract,
 10 24 not including loss or restriction of medical staff privileges
 10 25 or  exclusion from a provider panel, if the sanctioned
 10 26 provider acts under this chapter while on the premises of the
 10 27 sanctioning health care provider or on property that is owned
 10 28 by or under the direct control of the sanctioning health care
 10 29 provider.
 10 30    (3)  Termination of a contract or other nonmonetary remedies
 10 31 provided by a contract if the sanctioned provider acts under
 10 32 this chapter while acting in the course and scope of the
 10 33 sanctioned provider's capacity as an employee or independent
 10 34 contractor of the sanctioning health care provider. Nothing
 10 35 in this subparagraph shall be construed to prevent any of the
 11  1 following:
 11  2    (a)  A health care provider from acting under this chapter
 11  3 while acting  outside the course and scope of the provider's
 11  4 capacity as an employee or independent contractor.
 11  5    (b)  A patient from contracting with the patient's attending
 11  6 physician and consulting physician to act outside the course
 11  7 and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11  8 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11  9    c.  A health care provider that imposes sanctions pursuant to
 11 10 paragraph "b" shall follow all due process and other procedures
 11 11 the sanctioning health care provider uses for the imposition of
 11 12 sanctions on other health care providers under the authority of
 11 13 the sanctioning health care provider.

  9 29 patient's request under this chapter  and the patient transfers
  9 30 the patient's care to a new health care provider, the prior
  9 31 health care provider shall transfer, upon request, a copy of
  9 32 the patient's relevant medical records to the new health care
  9 33 provider.
  9 34    5.  a.  Notwithstanding any other provision of law to the
  9 35 contrary, a health care provider may prohibit another health
 10  1 care provider from acting under this chapter on the premises
 10  2 of the prohibiting provider if the prohibiting provider has
 10  3 notified the health care provider of the prohibiting provider's
 10  4 policy regarding actions under this chapter. Nothing in this
 10  5 paragraph shall prevent a health care provider from providing
 10  6 health care services to a patient that do not constitute action
 10  7 under this chapter.
 10  8    b.  Notwithstanding the provisions of this section to the
 10  9 contrary,  a health  care provider may subject another health
 10 10 care provider to the following sanctions if the sanctioning
 10 11 health care provider has notified the sanctioned provider prior
 10 12 to action under this chapter that the health care provider
 10 13 prohibits actions under this chapter:
 10 14    (1)  Loss of privileges, loss of membership, or other
 10 15 sanction provided pursuant to the medical staff bylaws,
 10 16 policies, or procedures of the sanctioning health care provider
 10 17 if the sanctioned provider is a member of the sanctioning
 10 18 provider's medical staff and acts under this chapter while on
 10 19 the health care facility premises of the sanctioning health
 10 20 care provider, but not including the private medical office of
 10 21 a physician or other provider.
 10 22    (2)  Termination of a lease or other property contract or
 10 23 other nonmonetary remedies  provided by a lease or contract,
 10 24 not including loss or restriction of medical staff privileges
 10 25 or  exclusion from a provider panel, if the sanctioned
 10 26 provider acts under this chapter while on the premises of the
 10 27 sanctioning health care provider or on property that is owned
 10 28 by or under the direct control of the sanctioning health care
 10 29 provider.
 10 30    (3)  Termination of a contract or other nonmonetary remedies
 10 31 provided by a contract if the sanctioned provider acts under
 10 32 this chapter while acting in the course and scope of the
 10 33 sanctioned provider's capacity as an employee or independent
 10 34 contractor of the sanctioning health care provider. Nothing
 10 35 in this subparagraph shall be construed to prevent any of the
 11  1 following:
 11  2    (a)  A health care provider from acting under this chapter
 11  3 while acting  outside the course and scope of the provider's
 11  4 capacity as an employee or independent contractor.
 11  5    (b)  A patient from contracting with the patient's attending
 11  6 physician and consulting physician to act outside the course
 11  7 and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11  8 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11  9    c.  A health care provider that imposes sanctions pursuant to
 11 10 paragraph "b" shall follow all due process and other procedures
 11 11 the sanctioning health care provider uses for the imposition of
 11 12 sanctions on other health care providers under the authority of
 11 13 the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 14    d.  For the purposes of this subsection:
 11 15    (1)  "Action under this chapter" means to perform the
 11 16 duties of an  attending physician, the consulting physician
 11 17 function, or the counseling function as specified under this
 11 18 chapter. "Action under this chapter" does not include any of
 11 19 the following:
 11 20    (a)  Making an initial determination that a patient has
 11 21 a terminal disease and informing the patient of the medical
 11 22 prognosis.
 11 23    (b)  Providing information about this chapter to a patient
 11 24 upon the  request of the patient.
 11 25    (c)  Providing a patient, upon the request of the patient,
 11 26 with a referral to another physician.
 11 27    (d)  A patient contracting with the patient's attending
 11 28 physician and consulting physician to act outside of the
 11 29 course and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11 30 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 31    (2)  "Notify" means a separate statement in writing to the
 11 32 health care provider  specifically informing the health care
 11 33 provider prior to the provider's action under this chapter of
 11 34 the sanctioning health care provider's policy about actions
 11 35 under this chapter.
 12  1    Sec. 15.    9 27 medication to end the patient's life pursuant to this chapter.
  9 28 If a health care provider is unable or unwilling to carry out a
  9 29 patient's request under this chapter  and the patient transfers
  9 30 the patient's care to a new health care provider, the prior
  9 31 health care provider shall transfer, upon request, a copy of
  9 32 the patient's relevant medical records to the new health care
  9 33 provider.

 10 14    (1)  Loss of privileges, loss of membership, or other
 10 15 sanction provided pursuant to the medical staff bylaws,
 10 16 policies, or procedures of the sanctioning health care provider
 10 17 if the sanctioned provider is a member of the sanctioning
 10 18 provider's medical staff and acts under this chapter while on
 10 19 the health care facility premises of the sanctioning health
 10 20 care provider, but not including the private medical office of
 10 21 a physician or other provider.
 10 22    (2)  Termination of a lease or other property contract or
 10 23 other nonmonetary remedies  provided by a lease or contract,
 10 24 not including loss or restriction of medical staff privileges
 10 25 or  exclusion from a provider panel, if the sanctioned
 10 26 provider acts under this chapter while on the premises of the
 10 27 sanctioning health care provider or on property that is owned
 10 28 by or under the direct control of the sanctioning health care
 10 29 provider.
 10 30    (3)  Termination of a contract or other nonmonetary remedies
 10 31 provided by a contract if the sanctioned provider acts under
 10 32 this chapter while acting in the course and scope of the
 10 33 sanctioned provider's capacity as an employee or independent
 10 34 contractor of the sanctioning health care provider. Nothing
 10 35 in this subparagraph shall be construed to prevent any of the
 11  1 following:
 11  2    (a)  A health care provider from acting under this chapter
 11  3 while acting  outside the course and scope of the provider's
 11  4 capacity as an employee or independent contractor.
 11  5    (b)  A patient from contracting with the patient's attending
 11  6 physician and consulting physician to act outside the course
 11  7 and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11  8 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11  9    c.  A health care provider that imposes sanctions pursuant to
 11 10 paragraph "b" shall follow all due process and other procedures
 11 11 the sanctioning health care provider uses for the imposition of
 11 12 sanctions on other health care providers under the authority of
 11 13 the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 14    d.  For the purposes of this subsection:
 11 15    (1)  "Action under this chapter" means to perform the
 11 16 duties of an  attending physician, the consulting physician
 11 17 function, or the counseling function as specified under this
 11 18 chapter. "Action under this chapter" does not include any of
 11 19 the following:
 11 20    (a)  Making an initial determination that a patient has
 11 21 a terminal disease and informing the patient of the medical
 11 22 prognosis.
 11 23    (b)  Providing information about this chapter to a patient
 11 24 upon the  request of the patient.
 11 25    (c)  Providing a patient, upon the request of the patient,
 11 26 with a referral to another physician.
 11 27    (d)  A patient contracting with the patient's attending
 11 28 physician and consulting physician to act outside of the
 11 29 course and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11 30 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 31    (2)  "Notify" means a separate statement in writing to the
 11 32 health care provider  specifically informing the health care
 11 33 provider prior to the provider's action under this chapter of
 11 34 the sanctioning health care provider's policy about actions
 11 35 under this chapter.
 12  1    Sec. 15.    9 34    5.  a.  Notwithstanding any other provision of law to the
  9 35 contrary, a health care provider may prohibit another health
 10  1 care provider from acting under this chapter on the premises
 10  2 of the prohibiting provider if the prohibiting provider has
 10  3 notified the health care provider of the prohibiting provider's
 10  4 policy regarding actions under this chapter. Nothing in this
 10  5 paragraph shall prevent a health care provider from providing
 10  6 health care services to a patient that do not constitute action
 10  7 under this chapter.
 10  8    b.  Notwithstanding the provisions of this section to the
 10  9 contrary,  a health  care provider may subject another health
 10 10 care provider to the following sanctions if the sanctioning
 10 11 health care provider has notified the sanctioned provider prior
 10 12 to action under this chapter that the health care provider
 10 13 prohibits actions under this chapter:
 10 14    (1)  Loss of privileges, loss of membership, or other
 10 15 sanction provided pursuant to the medical staff bylaws,
 10 16 policies, or procedures of the sanctioning health care provider
 10 17 if the sanctioned provider is a member of the sanctioning
 10 18 provider's medical staff and acts under this chapter while on
 10 19 the health care facility premises of the sanctioning health
 10 20 care provider, but not including the private medical office of
 10 21 a physician or other provider.
 10 22    (2)  Termination of a lease or other property contract or
 10 23 other nonmonetary remedies  provided by a lease or contract,
 10 24 not including loss or restriction of medical staff privileges
 10 25 or  exclusion from a provider panel, if the sanctioned
 10 26 provider acts under this chapter while on the premises of the
 10 27 sanctioning health care provider or on property that is owned
 10 28 by or under the direct control of the sanctioning health care
 10 29 provider.
 10 30    (3)  Termination of a contract or other nonmonetary remedies
 10 31 provided by a contract if the sanctioned provider acts under
 10 32 this chapter while acting in the course and scope of the
 10 33 sanctioned provider's capacity as an employee or independent
 10 34 contractor of the sanctioning health care provider. Nothing
 10 35 in this subparagraph shall be construed to prevent any of the
 11  1 following:
 11  2    (a)  A health care provider from acting under this chapter
 11  3 while acting  outside the course and scope of the provider's
 11  4 capacity as an employee or independent contractor.
 11  5    (b)  A patient from contracting with the patient's attending
 11  6 physician and consulting physician to act outside the course
 11  7 and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11  8 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11  9    c.  A health care provider that imposes sanctions pursuant to
 11 10 paragraph "b" shall follow all due process and other procedures
 11 11 the sanctioning health care provider uses for the imposition of
 11 12 sanctions on other health care providers under the authority of
 11 13 the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 14    d.  For the purposes of this subsection:
 11 15    (1)  "Action under this chapter" means to perform the
 11 16 duties of an  attending physician, the consulting physician
 11 17 function, or the counseling function as specified under this
 11 18 chapter. "Action under this chapter" does not include any of
 11 19 the following:
 11 20    (a)  Making an initial determination that a patient has
 11 21 a terminal disease and informing the patient of the medical
 11 22 prognosis.
 11 23    (b)  Providing information about this chapter to a patient
 11 24 upon the  request of the patient.
 11 25    (c)  Providing a patient, upon the request of the patient,
 11 26 with a referral to another physician.
 11 27    (d)  A patient contracting with the patient's attending
 11 28 physician and consulting physician to act outside of the
 11 29 course and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11 30 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 31    (2)  "Notify" means a separate statement in writing to the
 11 32 health care provider  specifically informing the health care
 11 33 provider prior to the provider's action under this chapter of
 11 34 the sanctioning health care provider's policy about actions
 11 35 under this chapter.

 10  4 policy regarding actions under this chapter. Nothing in this
 10  5 paragraph shall prevent a health care provider from providing
 10  6 health care services to a patient that do not constitute action

 10 20 care provider, but not including the private medical office of
 10 21 a physician or other provider.
 10 22    (2)  Termination of a lease or other property contract or
 10 23 other nonmonetary remedies  provided by a lease or contract,
 10 24 not including loss or restriction of medical staff privileges
 10 25 or  exclusion from a provider panel, if the sanctioned
 10 26 provider acts under this chapter while on the premises of the
 10 27 sanctioning health care provider or on property that is owned
 10 28 by or under the direct control of the sanctioning health care
 10 29 provider.
 10 30    (3)  Termination of a contract or other nonmonetary remedies
 10 31 provided by a contract if the sanctioned provider acts under
 10 32 this chapter while acting in the course and scope of the
 10 33 sanctioned provider's capacity as an employee or independent
 10 34 contractor of the sanctioning health care provider. Nothing
 10 35 in this subparagraph shall be construed to prevent any of the
 11  1 following:
 11  2    (a)  A health care provider from acting under this chapter
 11  3 while acting  outside the course and scope of the provider's
 11  4 capacity as an employee or independent contractor.
 11  5    (b)  A patient from contracting with the patient's attending
 11  6 physician and consulting physician to act outside the course
 11  7 and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11  8 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11  9    c.  A health care provider that imposes sanctions pursuant to
 11 10 paragraph "b" shall follow all due process and other procedures
 11 11 the sanctioning health care provider uses for the imposition of
 11 12 sanctions on other health care providers under the authority of
 11 13 the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 14    d.  For the purposes of this subsection:
 11 15    (1)  "Action under this chapter" means to perform the
 11 16 duties of an  attending physician, the consulting physician
 11 17 function, or the counseling function as specified under this
 11 18 chapter. "Action under this chapter" does not include any of
 11 19 the following:
 11 20    (a)  Making an initial determination that a patient has
 11 21 a terminal disease and informing the patient of the medical
 11 22 prognosis.
 11 23    (b)  Providing information about this chapter to a patient
 11 24 upon the  request of the patient.
 11 25    (c)  Providing a patient, upon the request of the patient,
 11 26 with a referral to another physician.
 11 27    (d)  A patient contracting with the patient's attending
 11 28 physician and consulting physician to act outside of the
 11 29 course and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11 30 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 31    (2)  "Notify" means a separate statement in writing to the
 11 32 health care provider  specifically informing the health care
 11 33 provider prior to the provider's action under this chapter of
 11 34 the sanctioning health care provider's policy about actions
 11 35 under this chapter.
 12  1    Sec. 15.   10  7 under this chapter.
 10  8    b.  Notwithstanding the provisions of this section to the
 10  9 contrary,  a health  care provider may subject another health
 10 10 care provider to the following sanctions if the sanctioning
 10 11 health care provider has notified the sanctioned provider prior
 10 12 to action under this chapter that the health care provider
 10 13 prohibits actions under this chapter:
 10 14    (1)  Loss of privileges, loss of membership, or other
 10 15 sanction provided pursuant to the medical staff bylaws,
 10 16 policies, or procedures of the sanctioning health care provider
 10 17 if the sanctioned provider is a member of the sanctioning
 10 18 provider's medical staff and acts under this chapter while on
 10 19 the health care facility premises of the sanctioning health
 10 20 care provider, but not including the private medical office of
 10 21 a physician or other provider.
 10 22    (2)  Termination of a lease or other property contract or
 10 23 other nonmonetary remedies  provided by a lease or contract,
 10 24 not including loss or restriction of medical staff privileges
 10 25 or  exclusion from a provider panel, if the sanctioned
 10 26 provider acts under this chapter while on the premises of the
 10 27 sanctioning health care provider or on property that is owned
 10 28 by or under the direct control of the sanctioning health care
 10 29 provider.
 10 30    (3)  Termination of a contract or other nonmonetary remedies
 10 31 provided by a contract if the sanctioned provider acts under
 10 32 this chapter while acting in the course and scope of the
 10 33 sanctioned provider's capacity as an employee or independent
 10 34 contractor of the sanctioning health care provider. Nothing
 10 35 in this subparagraph shall be construed to prevent any of the
 11  1 following:
 11  2    (a)  A health care provider from acting under this chapter

 11  4 capacity as an employee or independent contractor.

 11  6 physician and consulting physician to act outside the course

 11 13 the sanctioning health care provider.

 10 33 sanctioned provider's capacity as an employee or independent
 10 34 contractor of the sanctioning health care provider. Nothing
 10 35 in this subparagraph shall be construed to prevent any of the
 11  1 following:
 11  2    (a)  A health care provider from acting under this chapter
 11  3 while acting  outside the course and scope of the provider's
 11  4 capacity as an employee or independent contractor.
 11  5    (b)  A patient from contracting with the patient's attending
 11  6 physician and consulting physician to act outside the course
 11  7 and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11  8 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11  9    c.  A health care provider that imposes sanctions pursuant to
 11 10 paragraph "b" shall follow all due process and other procedures
 11 11 the sanctioning health care provider uses for the imposition of
 11 12 sanctions on other health care providers under the authority of
 11 13 the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 14    d.  For the purposes of this subsection:
 11 15    (1)  "Action under this chapter" means to perform the
 11 16 duties of an  attending physician, the consulting physician
 11 17 function, or the counseling function as specified under this
 11 18 chapter. "Action under this chapter" does not include any of
 11 19 the following:
 11 20    (a)  Making an initial determination that a patient has
 11 21 a terminal disease and informing the patient of the medical
 11 22 prognosis.
 11 23    (b)  Providing information about this chapter to a patient
 11 24 upon the  request of the patient.
 11 25    (c)  Providing a patient, upon the request of the patient,
 11 26 with a referral to another physician.
 11 27    (d)  A patient contracting with the patient's attending
 11 28 physician and consulting physician to act outside of the
 11 29 course and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11 30 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 31    (2)  "Notify" means a separate statement in writing to the
 11 32 health care provider  specifically informing the health care
 11 33 provider prior to the provider's action under this chapter of
 11 34 the sanctioning health care provider's policy about actions
 11 35 under this chapter.
 12  1    Sec. 15.   10 16 policies, or procedures of the sanctioning health care provider
 10 17 if the sanctioned provider is a member of the sanctioning
 10 18 provider's medical staff and acts under this chapter while on
 10 19 the health care facility premises of the sanctioning health
 10 20 care provider, but not including the private medical office of
 10 21 a physician or other provider.
 10 22    (2)  Termination of a lease or other property contract or
 10 23 other nonmonetary remedies  provided by a lease or contract,
 10 24 not including loss or restriction of medical staff privileges
 10 25 or  exclusion from a provider panel, if the sanctioned
 10 26 provider acts under this chapter while on the premises of the
 10 27 sanctioning health care provider or on property that is owned
 10 28 by or under the direct control of the sanctioning health care
 10 29 provider.
 10 30    (3)  Termination of a contract or other nonmonetary remedies
 10 31 provided by a contract if the sanctioned provider acts under
 10 32 this chapter while acting in the course and scope of the
 10 33 sanctioned provider's capacity as an employee or independent
 10 34 contractor of the sanctioning health care provider. Nothing
 10 35 in this subparagraph shall be construed to prevent any of the
 11  1 following:
 11  2    (a)  A health care provider from acting under this chapter
 11  3 while acting  outside the course and scope of the provider's
 11  4 capacity as an employee or independent contractor.
 11  5    (b)  A patient from contracting with the patient's attending
 11  6 physician and consulting physician to act outside the course
 11  7 and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11  8 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11  9    c.  A health care provider that imposes sanctions pursuant to
 11 10 paragraph "b" shall follow all due process and other procedures
 11 11 the sanctioning health care provider uses for the imposition of
 11 12 sanctions on other health care providers under the authority of
 11 13 the sanctioning health care provider.

 11  1 following:
 11  2    (a)  A health care provider from acting under this chapter
 11  3 while acting  outside the course and scope of the provider's
 11  4 capacity as an employee or independent contractor.
 11  5    (b)  A patient from contracting with the patient's attending
 11  6 physician and consulting physician to act outside the course
 11  7 and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11  8 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11  9    c.  A health care provider that imposes sanctions pursuant to
 11 10 paragraph "b" shall follow all due process and other procedures
 11 11 the sanctioning health care provider uses for the imposition of
 11 12 sanctions on other health care providers under the authority of
 11 13 the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 14    d.  For the purposes of this subsection:
 11 15    (1)  "Action under this chapter" means to perform the
 11 16 duties of an  attending physician, the consulting physician
 11 17 function, or the counseling function as specified under this
 11 18 chapter. "Action under this chapter" does not include any of
 11 19 the following:
 11 20    (a)  Making an initial determination that a patient has
 11 21 a terminal disease and informing the patient of the medical
 11 22 prognosis.
 11 23    (b)  Providing information about this chapter to a patient
 11 24 upon the  request of the patient.
 11 25    (c)  Providing a patient, upon the request of the patient,
 11 26 with a referral to another physician.
 11 27    (d)  A patient contracting with the patient's attending
 11 28 physician and consulting physician to act outside of the
 11 29 course and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11 30 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 31    (2)  "Notify" means a separate statement in writing to the
 11 32 health care provider  specifically informing the health care
 11 33 provider prior to the provider's action under this chapter of
 11 34 the sanctioning health care provider's policy about actions
 11 35 under this chapter.
 12  1    Sec. 15.   10 27 sanctioning health care provider or on property that is owned
 10 28 by or under the direct control of the sanctioning health care
 10 29 provider.
 10 30    (3)  Termination of a contract or other nonmonetary remedies
 10 31 provided by a contract if the sanctioned provider acts under
 10 32 this chapter while acting in the course and scope of the
 10 33 sanctioned provider's capacity as an employee or independent
 10 34 contractor of the sanctioning health care provider. Nothing
 10 35 in this subparagraph shall be construed to prevent any of the
 11  1 following:
 11  2    (a)  A health care provider from acting under this chapter
 11  3 while acting  outside the course and scope of the provider's
 11  4 capacity as an employee or independent contractor.
 11  5    (b)  A patient from contracting with the patient's attending
 11  6 physician and consulting physician to act outside the course
 11  7 and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11  8 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.

 11 10 paragraph "b" shall follow all due process and other procedures
 11 11 the sanctioning health care provider uses for the imposition of
 11 12 sanctions on other health care providers under the authority of
 11 13 the sanctioning health care provider.

 11 26 with a referral to another physician.
 11 27    (d)  A patient contracting with the patient's attending
 11 28 physician and consulting physician to act outside of the
 11 29 course and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11 30 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 31    (2)  "Notify" means a separate statement in writing to the
 11 32 health care provider  specifically informing the health care
 11 33 provider prior to the provider's action under this chapter of
 11 34 the sanctioning health care provider's policy about actions
 11 35 under this chapter.
 12  1    Sec. 15.   11  6 physician and consulting physician to act outside the course
 11  7 and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11  8 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11  9    c.  A health care provider that imposes sanctions pursuant to
 11 10 paragraph "b" shall follow all due process and other procedures
 11 11 the sanctioning health care provider uses for the imposition of
 11 12 sanctions on other health care providers under the authority of
 11 13 the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 14    d.  For the purposes of this subsection:
 11 15    (1)  "Action under this chapter" means to perform the
 11 16 duties of an  attending physician, the consulting physician
 11 17 function, or the counseling function as specified under this
 11 18 chapter. "Action under this chapter" does not include any of
 11 19 the following:
 11 20    (a)  Making an initial determination that a patient has
 11 21 a terminal disease and informing the patient of the medical
 11 22 prognosis.
 11 23    (b)  Providing information about this chapter to a patient
 11 24 upon the  request of the patient.
 11 25    (c)  Providing a patient, upon the request of the patient,
 11 26 with a referral to another physician.
 11 27    (d)  A patient contracting with the patient's attending
 11 28 physician and consulting physician to act outside of the
 11 29 course and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11 30 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.
 11 31    (2)  "Notify" means a separate statement in writing to the
 11 32 health care provider  specifically informing the health care
 11 33 provider prior to the provider's action under this chapter of
 11 34 the sanctioning health care provider's policy about actions
 11 35 under this chapter.
 12  1    Sec. 15.   11  7 and scope of the provider's capacity as an employee or
 11  8 independent contractor of the sanctioning health care provider.

 11 10 paragraph "b" shall follow all due process and other procedures
 11 11 the sanctioning health care provider uses for the imposition of
 11 12 sanctions on other health care providers under the authority of
 11 13 the sanctioning health care provider.

 12  1    Sec. 15.   11 34 the sanctioning health care provider's policy about actions
 11 35 under this chapter.
 12  1    Sec. 15.   11 35 under this chapter.
 12  1    Sec. 15.   12  1    Sec. 15.   12  2    1.  A person who without authorization of the patient
 12  3 willfully alters or forges a request for medication under this
 12  4 chapter or conceals or destroys a recision of a request for
 12  5 medication under this chapter with the intent or effect of
 12  6 causing the patient's death is guilty of a class "A" felony.
 12  7    2.  A person who coerces or exerts undue influence on a
 12  8 patient to request medication  for the purpose of ending the
 12  9 patient's life pursuant to this chapter, or to destroy a
 12 10 recision of such a request,  is guilty of a class "A" felony.
 12 11    3.  Nothing in this chapter shall be construed to limit
 12 12 a person's liability for civil damages resulting from the
 12 13 person's negligent conduct or intentional misconduct applicable
 12 14 under other law for conduct which is inconsistent with the
 12 15 provisions of this chapter.
 12 16    4.  The penalties specified in this section shall not
 12 17 preclude criminal penalties applicable under other law for
 12 18 conduct which is inconsistent with the provisions of this
 12 19 chapter.
 12 20    Sec. 16.   12  3 willfully alters or forges a request for medication under this
 12  4 chapter or conceals or destroys a recision of a request for
 12  5 medication under this chapter with the intent or effect of
 12  6 causing the patient's death is guilty of a class "A" felony.
 12  7    2.  A person who coerces or exerts undue influence on a
 12  8 patient to request medication  for the purpose of ending the
 12  9 patient's life pursuant to this chapter, or to destroy a
 12 10 recision of such a request,  is guilty of a class "A" felony.
 12 11    3.  Nothing in this chapter shall be construed to limit
 12 12 a person's liability for civil damages resulting from the
 12 13 person's negligent conduct or intentional misconduct applicable
 12 14 under other law for conduct which is inconsistent with the
 12 15 provisions of this chapter.
 12 16    4.  The penalties specified in this section shall not
 12 17 preclude criminal penalties applicable under other law for
 12 18 conduct which is inconsistent with the provisions of this
 12 19 chapter.

 12  9 patient's life pursuant to this chapter, or to destroy a
 12 10 recision of such a request,  is guilty of a class "A" felony.
 12 11    3.  Nothing in this chapter shall be construed to limit
 12 12 a person's liability for civil damages resulting from the
 12 13 person's negligent conduct or intentional misconduct applicable
 12 14 under other law for conduct which is inconsistent with the
 12 15 provisions of this chapter.
 12 16    4.  The penalties specified in this section shall not
 12 17 preclude criminal penalties applicable under other law for
 12 18 conduct which is inconsistent with the provisions of this
 12 19 chapter.
 12 20    Sec. 16.   12  7    2.  A person who coerces or exerts undue influence on a
 12  8 patient to request medication  for the purpose of ending the
 12  9 patient's life pursuant to this chapter, or to destroy a
 12 10 recision of such a request,  is guilty of a class "A" felony.
 12 11    3.  Nothing in this chapter shall be construed to limit
 12 12 a person's liability for civil damages resulting from the
 12 13 person's negligent conduct or intentional misconduct applicable
 12 14 under other law for conduct which is inconsistent with the
 12 15 provisions of this chapter.

 12 17 preclude criminal penalties applicable under other law for
 12 18 conduct which is inconsistent with the provisions of this
 12 19 chapter.

 12  9 patient's life pursuant to this chapter, or to destroy a
 12 10 recision of such a request,  is guilty of a class "A" felony.

 12 12 a person's liability for civil damages resulting from the
 12 13 person's negligent conduct or intentional misconduct applicable
 12 14 under other law for conduct which is inconsistent with the
 12 15 provisions of this chapter.
 12 16    4.  The penalties specified in this section shall not
 12 17 preclude criminal penalties applicable under other law for
 12 18 conduct which is inconsistent with the provisions of this
 12 19 chapter.

 12 10 recision of such a request,  is guilty of a class "A" felony.

 12 13 person's negligent conduct or intentional misconduct applicable
 12 14 under other law for conduct which is inconsistent with the
 12 15 provisions of this chapter.

 12 17 preclude criminal penalties applicable under other law for
 12 18 conduct which is inconsistent with the provisions of this
 12 19 chapter.
 12 20    Sec. 16.   12 10 recision of such a request,  is guilty of a class "A" felony.
 12 11    3.  Nothing in this chapter shall be construed to limit
 12 12 a person's liability for civil damages resulting from the
 12 13 person's negligent conduct or intentional misconduct applicable
 12 14 under other law for conduct which is inconsistent with the
 12 15 provisions of this chapter.
 12 16    4.  The penalties specified in this section shall not
 12 17 preclude criminal penalties applicable under other law for
 12 18 conduct which is inconsistent with the provisions of this
 12 19 chapter.
 12 20    Sec. 16.   12 11    3.  Nothing in this chapter shall be construed to limit
 12 12 a person's liability for civil damages resulting from the
 12 13 person's negligent conduct or intentional misconduct applicable
 12 14 under other law for conduct which is inconsistent with the
 12 15 provisions of this chapter.
 12 16    4.  The penalties specified in this section shall not
 12 17 preclude criminal penalties applicable under other law for
 12 18 conduct which is inconsistent with the provisions of this
 12 19 chapter.
 12 20    Sec. 16.   12 12 a person's liability for civil damages resulting from the
 12 13 person's negligent conduct or intentional misconduct applicable
 12 14 under other law for conduct which is inconsistent with the
 12 15 provisions of this chapter.
 12 16    4.  The penalties specified in this section shall not
 12 17 preclude criminal penalties applicable under other law for
 12 18 conduct which is inconsistent with the provisions of this
 12 19 chapter.
 12 20    Sec. 16.   12 13 person's negligent conduct or intentional misconduct applicable
 12 14 under other law for conduct which is inconsistent with the
 12 15 provisions of this chapter.
 12 16    4.  The penalties specified in this section shall not
 12 17 preclude criminal penalties applicable under other law for
 12 18 conduct which is inconsistent with the provisions of this
 12 19 chapter.
 12 20    Sec. 16.   12 14 under other law for conduct which is inconsistent with the
 12 15 provisions of this chapter.
 12 16    4.  The penalties specified in this section shall not
 12 17 preclude criminal penalties applicable under other law for
 12 18 conduct which is inconsistent with the provisions of this
 12 19 chapter.
 12 20    Sec. 16.   12 15 provisions of this chapter.
 12 16    4.  The penalties specified in this section shall not
 12 17 preclude criminal penalties applicable under other law for
 12 18 conduct which is inconsistent with the provisions of this
 12 19 chapter.
 12 20    Sec. 16.   12 16    4.  The penalties specified in this section shall not
 12 17 preclude criminal penalties applicable under other law for
 12 18 conduct which is inconsistent with the provisions of this
 12 19 chapter.
 12 20    Sec. 16.   12 17 preclude criminal penalties applicable under other law for
 12 18 conduct which is inconsistent with the provisions of this
 12 19 chapter.
 12 20    Sec. 16.   12 18 conduct which is inconsistent with the provisions of this
 12 19 chapter.
 12 20    Sec. 16.   12 19 chapter.
 12 20    Sec. 16.   12 20    Sec. 16.   12 21 for costs incurred.
 12 22    A governmental entity that incurs costs resulting from a
 12 23 person terminating the person's life  pursuant to this chapter
 12 24 in a public place shall have a claim against the estate of
 12 25 the person to recover such costs and reasonable attorney fees
 12 26 related to enforcing the claim.
 12 27    Sec. 17.   12 22    A governmental entity that incurs costs resulting from a
 12 23 person terminating the person's life  pursuant to this chapter
 12 24 in a public place shall have a claim against the estate of
 12 25 the person to recover such costs and reasonable attorney fees
 12 26 related to enforcing the claim.
 12 27    Sec. 17.   12 23 person terminating the person's life  pursuant to this chapter
 12 24 in a public place shall have a claim against the estate of
 12 25 the person to recover such costs and reasonable attorney fees
 12 26 related to enforcing the claim.
 12 27    Sec. 17.   12 24 in a public place shall have a claim against the estate of
 12 25 the person to recover such costs and reasonable attorney fees
 12 26 related to enforcing the claim.
 12 27    Sec. 17.   12 25 the person to recover such costs and reasonable attorney fees
 12 26 related to enforcing the claim.
 12 27    Sec. 17.   12 26 related to enforcing the claim.
 12 27    Sec. 17.   12 27    Sec. 17.   12 28    A written request for medication as authorized by this
 12 29 chapter shall be in substantially the following form:
 12 30    REQUEST FOR MEDICATION
 12 31 TO END MY LIFE IN A HUMANE
 12 32 AND DIGNIFIED MANNER
 12 33 I, ______________________, am an adult of sound mind.
 12 34 I am suffering from _________, which my attending physician has
 12 35 determined is a  terminal disease and which has been medically
 13  1 confirmed by a consulting physician.
 13  2 I have been fully informed of my diagnosis, prognosis, the
 13  3 nature of medication to be  prescribed and potential associated
 13  4 risks, the expected result, and the feasible  alternatives,
 13  5 including comfort care, hospice care, and pain control.
 13  6 I request that my attending physician prescribe medication that
 13  7 will end my life in a  humane and dignified manner.
 13  8 INITIAL ONE OF THE FOLLOWING:
 13  9 ______ I have informed my family of my decision and taken their
 13 10 opinions into  consideration.
 13 11 ______ I have decided not to inform my family of my decision.
 13 12 ______ I have no family to inform of my decision.
 13 13 I understand that I have the right to rescind this request at
 13 14 any time.
 13 15 I understand the full import of this request and I expect to
 13 16 die when I take the  medication to be prescribed. I further
 13 17 understand that although most deaths occur  within three hours,
 13 18 my death may take longer and my physician has counseled me
 13 19 about this possibility.
 13 20 I make this request voluntarily and without reservation, and I
 13 21 accept full moral  responsibility for my actions.
 13 22 Signed: _______________
 13 23 Dated: _______________
 13 24 DECLARATION OF WITNESSES
 13 25 By initialing and signing below on or after the date the person
 13 26 named above signs, we declare that the person making and
 13 27 signing the above request:
 13 28 (a) Is personally known to us or has provided proof of
 13 29 identity.
 13 30 (b) Signed this request in our presence on the date of the
 13 31 person's signature.
 13 32 (c) Appears to be of sound mind and not under duress, fraud, or
 13 33 undue influence.
 13 34 (d) Is not a patient for whom either of us is the attending
 13 35 physician.
 14  1 Printed name of Witness 1 ____________________
 14  2 Signed name of Witness 1/Date ________________________
 14  3 Printed name of Witness 2 ____________________
 14  4 Signed name of Witness 2/Date ________________________
 14  5 NOTE:  One witness shall not be a relative by blood, marriage,
 14  6 or adoption of the  person signing this request, shall not be
 14  7 entitled to any portion of the person's estate  upon death,
 14  8 and shall not own, operate, or be employed at a health care
 14  9 facility where  the person is a patient or resident. If the
 14 10 patient is an inpatient at a health care facility,  one of the
 14 11 witnesses shall be an individual designated by the facility.
 14 12                           EXPLANATION
 14 13 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
 14 14 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
 14 15    This bill creates the "Iowa End=of=Life Options Act". The
 14 16 bill provides for a competent adult patient, who is a resident
 14 17 of the state of Iowa, who is terminally ill with less than six
 14 18 months to live as verified by two physicians, to voluntarily
 14 19 request medication that will end the person's life. The
 14 20 bill provides that the patient must make an oral request, a
 14 21 subsequent oral request no less than 15 days after the initial
 14 22 request, and a written request for the medication.  There is
 14 23 also a 48=hour  waiting period between the submission of the
 14 24 written request and the writing of the prescription.  The bill
 14 25 specifies the responsibilities of the attending physician and
 14 26 the consulting physician.  The bill includes a provision for
 14 27 counseling if the attending physician deems it appropriate, the
 14 28 notification of next of kin, the right to rescind a request at
 14 29 any time, and documentation requirements.  The bill provides
 14 30 for the effect of a request for medication to end the person's
 14 31 life on the construction of wills, contracts, and statutes as
 14 32 well as on insurance and annuity policies.
 14 33    The bill provides that the provisions of the bill are not
 14 34 to be construed to authorize a physician or any other person
 14 35 to end a patient's life by lethal injection, mercy killing,
 15  1 or active euthanasia, and that actions taken in accordance
 15  2 with the bill shall not, for any purpose, constitute suicide,
 15  3 assisted suicide, mercy killing, or homicide under the
 15  4 law.  Additionally, the provisions of the bill are not to be
 15  5 interpreted to lessen the applicable standard of care for the
 15  6 attending physician, consulting physician, psychiatrist, or
 15  7 psychologist, or other health care provider acting under the
 15  8 bill.
 15  9    The bill provides immunities for a person who acts in
 15 10 good=faith compliance with the bill, including being present
 15 11 when a patient takes the prescribed medication to end the
 15 12 patient's life.
 15 13    The bill provides that a professional organization or
 15 14 association, or health care provider, shall not subject a
 15 15 person to censure, discipline, suspension, loss of license,
 15 16 loss of privileges, loss of  membership, or other penalty for
 15 17 acting or refusing to act in good=faith  compliance with the
 15 18 bill, but does provide for prohibitions by a health care
 15 19 provider on the premises of the health care provider relative
 15 20 to the bill. The bill provides that a request by a patient
 15 21 for or provision by an attending physician of medication in
 15 22 good=faith compliance with the bill does not constitute neglect
 15 23 under the law or provide the sole basis for the appointment
 15 24 of a guardian or conservator for the patient.  Under the
 15 25 bill, a health care provider is not to be under any duty,
 15 26 whether by contract, statute, or any other legal requirement
 15 27 to participate in the provision to a patient of medication to
 15 28 end the patient's  life.   If a health care provider is unable
 15 29 or unwilling to carry out a patient's request under the bill,
 15 30 however, and the patient transfers the patient's care to a
 15 31 new health care provider, the prior health care provider is
 15 32 required to transfer, upon request, a copy of the patient's
 15 33 relevant medical records to the new health care provider.
 15 34    The bill provides that a person who without authorization of
 15 35 the patient willfully alters or forges a request for medication
 16  1 under the bill or conceals or destroys a recision of such a
 16  2 request with the intent or effect of causing the patient's
 16  3 death is guilty of a class "A" felony. Additionally, a   person
 16  4 who coerces or exerts undue influence on a patient to request
 16  5 medication for the purpose of ending the patient's life under
 16  6 the bill, or to destroy a recision of such a request, is guilty
 16  7 of a class "A" felony.  A  class "A" felony is punishable by
 16  8 confinement for life without possibility of parole.
 16  9    The bill provides that the provisions of the bill are
 16 10 not to be construed to limit a person's liability for civil
 16 11 damages resulting from other negligent conduct or intentional
 16 12 misconduct by the person and that the penalties specified in
 16 13 the bill shall not preclude criminal penalties  applicable under
 16 14 other law for conduct which is inconsistent with the provisions
 16 15 of the bill.
 16 16    The bill provides that if a governmental entity incurs costs
 16 17 resulting from a person terminating the person's life  under the
 16 18 bill in a public place, the governmental entity has a claim
 16 19 against the estate of the person to recover such costs and
 16 20 reasonable attorney fees related to enforcing the claim.
 16 21    The bill also provides the form for the request for
 16 22 medication to end a person's life.
       LSB 1402XS (3) 87
       pf/nh
 12 29 chapter shall be in substantially the following form:
 12 30    REQUEST FOR MEDICATION
 12 31 TO END MY LIFE IN A HUMANE
 12 32 AND DIGNIFIED MANNER
 12 33 I, ______________________, am an adult of sound mind.
 12 34 I am suffering from _________, which my attending physician has
 12 35 determined is a  terminal disease and which has been medically
 13  1 confirmed by a consulting physician.
 13  2 I have been fully informed of my diagnosis, prognosis, the
 13  3 nature of medication to be  prescribed and potential associated
 13  4 risks, the expected result, and the feasible  alternatives,
 13  5 including comfort care, hospice care, and pain control.
 13  6 I request that my attending physician prescribe medication that
 13  7 will end my life in a  humane and dignified manner.
 13  8 INITIAL ONE OF THE FOLLOWING:
 13  9 ______ I have informed my family of my decision and taken their
 13 10 opinions into  consideration.
 13 11 ______ I have decided not to inform my family of my decision.
 13 12 ______ I have no family to inform of my decision.
 13 13 I understand that I have the right to rescind this request at
 13 14 any time.
 13 15 I understand the full import of this request and I expect to
 13 16 die when I take the  medication to be prescribed. I further
 13 17 understand that although most deaths occur  within three hours,
 13 18 my death may take longer and my physician has counseled me
 13 19 about this possibility.
 13 20 I make this request voluntarily and without reservation, and I
 13 21 accept full moral  responsibility for my actions.
 13 22 Signed: _______________
 13 23 Dated: _______________
 13 24 DECLARATION OF WITNESSES
 13 25 By initialing and signing below on or after the date the person
 13 26 named above signs, we declare that the person making and
 13 27 signing the above request:
 13 28 (a) Is personally known to us or has provided proof of
 13 29 identity.
 13 30 (b) Signed this request in our presence on the date of the
 13 31 person's signature.
 13 32 (c) Appears to be of sound mind and not under duress, fraud, or
 13 33 undue influence.
 13 34 (d) Is not a patient for whom either of us is the attending
 13 35 physician.
 14  1 Printed name of Witness 1 ____________________
 14  2 Signed name of Witness 1/Date ________________________
 14  3 Printed name of Witness 2 ____________________
 14  4 Signed name of Witness 2/Date ________________________
 14  5 NOTE:  One witness shall not be a relative by blood, marriage,
 14  6 or adoption of the  person signing this request, shall not be
 14  7 entitled to any portion of the person's estate  upon death,
 14  8 and shall not own, operate, or be employed at a health care
 14  9 facility where  the person is a patient or resident. If the
 14 10 patient is an inpatient at a health care facility,  one of the
 14 11 witnesses shall be an individual designated by the facility.

 12 35 determined is a  terminal disease and which has been medically
 13  1 confirmed by a consulting physician.

 13 11 ______ I have decided not to inform my family of my decision.
 13 12 ______ I have no family to inform of my decision.
 13 13 I understand that I have the right to rescind this request at
 13 14 any time.
 13 15 I understand the full import of this request and I expect to
 13 16 die when I take the  medication to be prescribed. I further
 13 17 understand that although most deaths occur  within three hours,
 13 18 my death may take longer and my physician has counseled me
 13 19 about this possibility.
 13 20 I make this request voluntarily and without reservation, and I
 13 21 accept full moral  responsibility for my actions.
 13 22 Signed: _______________
 13 23 Dated: _______________
 13 24 DECLARATION OF WITNESSES
 13 25 By initialing and signing below on or after the date the person
 13 26 named above signs, we declare that the person making and
 13 27 signing the above request:
 13 28 (a) Is personally known to us or has provided proof of
 13 29 identity.
 13 30 (b) Signed this request in our presence on the date of the
 13 31 person's signature.
 13 32 (c) Appears to be of sound mind and not under duress, fraud, or
 13 33 undue influence.
 13 34 (d) Is not a patient for whom either of us is the attending
 13 35 physician.
 14  1 Printed name of Witness 1 ____________________
 14  2 Signed name of Witness 1/Date ________________________
 14  3 Printed name of Witness 2 ____________________
 14  4 Signed name of Witness 2/Date ________________________
 14  5 NOTE:  One witness shall not be a relative by blood, marriage,
 14  6 or adoption of the  person signing this request, shall not be
 14  7 entitled to any portion of the person's estate  upon death,
 14  8 and shall not own, operate, or be employed at a health care
 14  9 facility where  the person is a patient or resident. If the
 14 10 patient is an inpatient at a health care facility,  one of the
 14 11 witnesses shall be an individual designated by the facility.
 14 12                           EXPLANATION
 14 13 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
 14 14 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
 14 15    This bill creates the "Iowa End=of=Life Options Act". The
 14 16 bill provides for a competent adult patient, who is a resident
 14 17 of the state of Iowa, who is terminally ill with less than six
 14 18 months to live as verified by two physicians, to voluntarily
 14 19 request medication that will end the person's life. The
 14 20 bill provides that the patient must make an oral request, a
 14 21 subsequent oral request no less than 15 days after the initial
 14 22 request, and a written request for the medication.  There is
 14 23 also a 48=hour  waiting period between the submission of the
 14 24 written request and the writing of the prescription.  The bill
 14 25 specifies the responsibilities of the attending physician and
 14 26 the consulting physician.  The bill includes a provision for
 14 27 counseling if the attending physician deems it appropriate, the
 14 28 notification of next of kin, the right to rescind a request at
 14 29 any time, and documentation requirements.  The bill provides
 14 30 for the effect of a request for medication to end the person's
 14 31 life on the construction of wills, contracts, and statutes as
 14 32 well as on insurance and annuity policies.
 14 33    The bill provides that the provisions of the bill are not
 14 34 to be construed to authorize a physician or any other person
 14 35 to end a patient's life by lethal injection, mercy killing,
 15  1 or active euthanasia, and that actions taken in accordance
 15  2 with the bill shall not, for any purpose, constitute suicide,
 15  3 assisted suicide, mercy killing, or homicide under the
 15  4 law.  Additionally, the provisions of the bill are not to be
 15  5 interpreted to lessen the applicable standard of care for the
 15  6 attending physician, consulting physician, psychiatrist, or
 15  7 psychologist, or other health care provider acting under the
 15  8 bill.
 15  9    The bill provides immunities for a person who acts in
 15 10 good=faith compliance with the bill, including being present
 15 11 when a patient takes the prescribed medication to end the
 15 12 patient's life.
 15 13    The bill provides that a professional organization or
 15 14 association, or health care provider, shall not subject a
 15 15 person to censure, discipline, suspension, loss of license,
 15 16 loss of privileges, loss of  membership, or other penalty for
 15 17 acting or refusing to act in good=faith  compliance with the
 15 18 bill, but does provide for prohibitions by a health care
 15 19 provider on the premises of the health care provider relative
 15 20 to the bill. The bill provides that a request by a patient
 15 21 for or provision by an attending physician of medication in
 15 22 good=faith compliance with the bill does not constitute neglect
 15 23 under the law or provide the sole basis for the appointment
 15 24 of a guardian or conservator for the patient.  Under the
 15 25 bill, a health care provider is not to be under any duty,
 15 26 whether by contract, statute, or any other legal requirement
 15 27 to participate in the provision to a patient of medication to
 15 28 end the patient's  life.   If a health care provider is unable
 15 29 or unwilling to carry out a patient's request under the bill,
 15 30 however, and the patient transfers the patient's care to a
 15 31 new health care provider, the prior health care provider is
 15 32 required to transfer, upon request, a copy of the patient's
 15 33 relevant medical records to the new health care provider.
 15 34    The bill provides that a person who without authorization of
 15 35 the patient willfully alters or forges a request for medication
 16  1 under the bill or conceals or destroys a recision of such a
 16  2 request with the intent or effect of causing the patient's
 16  3 death is guilty of a class "A" felony. Additionally, a   person
 16  4 who coerces or exerts undue influence on a patient to request
 16  5 medication for the purpose of ending the patient's life under
 16  6 the bill, or to destroy a recision of such a request, is guilty
 16  7 of a class "A" felony.  A  class "A" felony is punishable by
 16  8 confinement for life without possibility of parole.
 16  9    The bill provides that the provisions of the bill are
 16 10 not to be construed to limit a person's liability for civil
 16 11 damages resulting from other negligent conduct or intentional
 16 12 misconduct by the person and that the penalties specified in
 16 13 the bill shall not preclude criminal penalties  applicable under
 16 14 other law for conduct which is inconsistent with the provisions
 16 15 of the bill.
 16 16    The bill provides that if a governmental entity incurs costs
 16 17 resulting from a person terminating the person's life  under the
 16 18 bill in a public place, the governmental entity has a claim
 16 19 against the estate of the person to recover such costs and
 16 20 reasonable attorney fees related to enforcing the claim.
 16 21    The bill also provides the form for the request for
 16 22 medication to end a person's life.
       LSB 1402XS (3) 87
       pf/nh
 12 32 AND DIGNIFIED MANNER
 12 33 I, ______________________, am an adult of sound mind.
 12 34 I am suffering from _________, which my attending physician has
 12 35 determined is a  terminal disease and which has been medically
 13  1 confirmed by a consulting physician.
 13  2 I have been fully informed of my diagnosis, prognosis, the
 13  3 nature of medication to be  prescribed and potential associated
 13  4 risks, the expected result, and the feasible  alternatives,
 13  5 including comfort care, hospice care, and pain control.
 13  6 I request that my attending physician prescribe medication that
 13  7 will end my life in a  humane and dignified manner.
 13  8 INITIAL ONE OF THE FOLLOWING:
 13  9 ______ I have informed my family of my decision and taken their
 13 10 opinions into  consideration.
 13 11 ______ I have decided not to inform my family of my decision.
 13 12 ______ I have no family to inform of my decision.
 13 13 I understand that I have the right to rescind this request at
 13 14 any time.
 13 15 I understand the full import of this request and I expect to
 13 16 die when I take the  medication to be prescribed. I further
 13 17 understand that although most deaths occur  within three hours,
 13 18 my death may take longer and my physician has counseled me
 13 19 about this possibility.
 13 20 I make this request voluntarily and without reservation, and I
 13 21 accept full moral  responsibility for my actions.
 13 22 Signed: _______________
 13 23 Dated: _______________
 13 24 DECLARATION OF WITNESSES
 13 25 By initialing and signing below on or after the date the person
 13 26 named above signs, we declare that the person making and
 13 27 signing the above request:
 13 28 (a) Is personally known to us or has provided proof of
 13 29 identity.
 13 30 (b) Signed this request in our presence on the date of the
 13 31 person's signature.
 13 32 (c) Appears to be of sound mind and not under duress, fraud, or
 13 33 undue influence.
 13 34 (d) Is not a patient for whom either of us is the attending
 13 35 physician.
 14  1 Printed name of Witness 1 ____________________
 14  2 Signed name of Witness 1/Date ________________________
 14  3 Printed name of Witness 2 ____________________
 14  4 Signed name of Witness 2/Date ________________________
 14  5 NOTE:  One witness shall not be a relative by blood, marriage,
 14  6 or adoption of the  person signing this request, shall not be
 14  7 entitled to any portion of the person's estate  upon death,
 14  8 and shall not own, operate, or be employed at a health care
 14  9 facility where  the person is a patient or resident. If the
 14 10 patient is an inpatient at a health care facility,  one of the
 14 11 witnesses shall be an individual designated by the facility.
